com.soa.policy.wspolicy
Interface PolicyMarshaller

public interface PolicyMarshaller

PolicyMarshler marshals policy to DOM-based XML and unmarshals DOM-based XML to Policy. During the process, it uses various AssertionMarshallers to help in the marshaling and unmarshaling of assertions nested in its policy. If no AssertionMarshaller can be found, by default this class uses the XmlAssertionMarshaller.

When marhsaling and unmarshaling assertions, this class handles all WS-Policy related constructs, such as assertion name, assertion optional, assertion ignorable, and assertion sub-policy. AssertionMarshaller's need only handle domain specific aspects of an assertion.

DOM objects such as Elements used in the unmarshaling process should be treated as read only. Clients that need to modify DOM objects either during unmarshaling or afterward must clone those objects first. Additionally, WS-Policy related DOM objects will remain in the DOM tree. This could include, for example, Policy elements or Optional attributes. These should generally be ignored by clients.

Method Detail

marshal

void marshal(Policy policy,
             org.w3c.dom.Node parent)
             throws GException
Marshals the given policy, resulting in a root Element that becomes a child of the given node.

PolicyReference's are marshalled as literal WS-PolicyReference's.

XmlAssertions's are shallow cloned via Document's importNode before being passed to their AssertionMarshaller for marshalling.

Parameters:
policy -
parent -
Throws:
GException

unmarshal

Policy unmarshal(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
                 throws GException
Returns a policy object representing the policy in the given element. The given element is the top level Policy element containing all the policy in question.

PolicyReferences are not dereferenced but instead are unmarshalled as PolicyReference's. This is useful for clients that need to preserve the original policy reference relationships found in policy.

Throws:
GException

unmarshal

Policy unmarshal(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                 ReferencedPolicyFactory rpf)
                 throws GException
Returns a policy object representing the policy in the given element. The given element is the top level Policy element containing all the policy in question or the top level PolicyReference element pointing to a policy.

PolicyReferences are processed via the passed in ReferencedPolicyFactory. Whenever a PolicyReference element is found nested in policy, this method will attempt to match the reference with a policy found in the factory. If a match is not found, an exception will be thrown. PolicyReference objects are never returned in the policy tree, only dereferenced policy.

Two different rulesets are followed for processing PolicyReferences. If the PolicyReference is the top level element passed to this method, the method assumes that the reference has been attached to some element and follows the rules of WS-PolicyAttachment 1.5 section 3.3. Alternatively if the PolicyReference is found nested within policy processed during unmarshalling, the method follows the rules of WS-Policy 1.5 section 4.3.5.

If a policy is not supposed to use PolicyReference's but validation is required in case it does, pass in a null ReferencedPolicyFactory.

Throws:
GException
